cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: firefox security update

full_product_name.product_name: firefox-0:68.6.1-1.el8_1 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 8)

notes.note: Mozilla: Use-after-free while running the nsDocShell destructor

reference.description: bz#1820869: CVE-2020-6819 Mozilla: Use-after-free while running the nsDocShell destructor

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

acknowledgment.description: Red Hat would like to thank the Mozilla project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Francisco Alonso and Javier Marcos as the original reporter.

notes.note: Mozilla: Use-after-free when handling a ReadableStream

reference.description: bz#1820878: CVE-2020-6820 Mozilla: Use-after-free when handling a ReadableStream

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

acknowledgment.description: Red Hat would like to thank the Mozilla project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Francisco Alonso and Javier Marcos as the original reporter.

note:
An update for firefox is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Critical. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, designed for standards compliance, performance, and portability.
This update upgrades Firefox to version 68.6.1 ESR.
Security Fix(es):
* Mozilla: Use-after-free while running the nsDocShell destructor (CVE-2020-6819)
* Mozilla: Use-after-free when handling a ReadableStream (CVE-2020-6820)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
